verses.kjv: On that day they read in the book of Moses in the audience of the people; and therein was found written, that the Ammonite and the Moabite should not come into the congregation of God for ever;
verses.ct: That day, the Book of Moses was read aloud to the people, and they discovered a passage stating that no Ammonite or Moabite should ever be allowed into the assembly of God.

verses.kjv: Because they met not the children of Israel with bread and with water, but hired Balaam against them, that he should curse them: howbeit our God turned the curse into a blessing.
verses.ct: This was because they had refused to provide the Israelites with food and water, and had instead hired Balaam to pronounce a curse against them — though our God turned that curse into a blessing.

verses.kjv: Now it came to pass, when they had heard the law, that they separated from Israel all the mixed multitude.
verses.ct: When the people heard this law, they removed everyone of foreign descent from Israel.

verses.kjv: And before this, Eliashib the priest, having the oversight of the chamber of the house of our God, was allied unto Tobiah:
verses.ct: Now before all this, the priest Eliashib, who was in charge of the storerooms of the house of our God, had a close relationship with Tobiah.

verses.kjv: And he had prepared for him a great chamber, where aforetime they laid the meat offerings, the frankincense, and the vessels, and the tithes of the corn, the new wine, and the oil, which was commanded to be given to the Levites, and the singers, and the porters; and the offerings of the priests.
verses.ct: He had set up a large room for Tobiah where they had previously stored the grain offerings, the frankincense, the temple equipment, and the tithes of grain, new wine, and olive oil that were designated for the Levites, the singers, and the gatekeepers, along with the contributions for the priests.

verses.kjv: But in all this time was not I at Jerusalem: for in the two and thirtieth year of Artaxerxes king of Babylon came I unto the king, and after certain days obtained I leave of the king:
verses.ct: During all of this, I was not in Jerusalem. In the 32nd year of King Artaxerxes of Babylon, I had returned to serve the king, and after some time I requested permission to leave.

verses.kjv: And I came to Jerusalem, and understood of the evil that Eliashib did for Tobiah, in preparing him a chamber in the courts of the house of God.
verses.ct: When I arrived back in Jerusalem, I learned about the terrible thing Eliashib had done by giving Tobiah a room in the courtyards of the house of God.

verses.kjv: And it grieved me sore: therefore I cast forth all the household stuff of Tobiah out of the chamber.
verses.ct: I was deeply upset, so I threw all of Tobiah's belongings out of the room.

verses.kjv: Then I commanded, and they cleansed the chambers: and thither brought I again the vessels of the house of God, with the meat offering and the frankincense.
verses.ct: Then I gave orders to purify the rooms, and I had the equipment of the house of God brought back in, along with the grain offerings and the frankincense.

verses.kjv: And I perceived that the portions of the Levites had not been given them: for the Levites and the singers, that did the work, were fled every one to his field.
verses.ct: I also discovered that the Levites had not been receiving their portions, so the Levites and singers responsible for the temple service had each gone back to work their own fields.

verses.kjv: Then contended I with the rulers, and said, Why is the house of God forsaken? And I gathered them together, and set them in their place.
verses.ct: I confronted the officials and demanded, "Why has the house of God been neglected?" Then I gathered the Levites and singers and restored them to their positions.

verses.kjv: Then brought all Judah the tithe of the corn and the new wine and the oil unto the treasuries.
verses.ct: After that, all of Judah began bringing their tithes of grain, new wine, and olive oil into the storehouses.

verses.kjv: And I made treasurers over the treasuries, Shelemiah the priest, and Zadok the scribe, and of the Levites, Pedaiah: and next to them was Hanan the son of Zaccur, the son of Mattaniah: for they were counted faithful, and their office was to distribute unto their brethren.
verses.ct: I appointed Shelemiah the priest, Zadok the scribe, and Pedaiah from the Levites to oversee the storehouses, with Hanan son of Zaccur, son of Mattaniah, as their assistant. These men were considered trustworthy, and their responsibility was to distribute supplies to their brothers.

verses.kjv: Remember me, O my God, concerning this, and wipe not out my good deeds that I have done for the house of my God, and for the offices thereof.
verses.ct: Remember me for this, my God, and don't erase the faithful service I have given to the house of my God and its operations.

verses.kjv: In those days saw I in Judah some treading wine presses on the sabbath, and bringing in sheaves, and lading asses; as also wine, grapes, and figs, and all manner of burdens, which they brought into Jerusalem on the sabbath day: and I testified against them in the day wherein they sold victuals.
verses.ct: During that time, I noticed people in Judah pressing grapes on the Sabbath, hauling in bundles of grain, and loading donkeys with wine, grapes, figs, and all kinds of goods to bring into Jerusalem on the Sabbath. I warned them against selling food on that day.

verses.kjv: There dwelt men of Tyre also therein, which brought fish, and all manner of ware, and sold on the sabbath unto the children of Judah, and in Jerusalem.
verses.ct: People from Tyre who lived there were also bringing in fish and all sorts of merchandise, selling them on the Sabbath to the people of Judah right in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: Then I contended with the nobles of Judah, and said unto them, What evil thing is this that ye do, and profane the sabbath day?
verses.ct: So I confronted the nobles of Judah and told them, "What is this wicked thing you're doing, violating the Sabbath?"

verses.kjv: Did not your fathers thus, and did not our God bring all this evil upon us, and upon this city? yet ye bring more wrath upon Israel by profaning the sabbath.
verses.ct: "Isn't this exactly what your ancestors did? And didn't our God bring all this disaster on us and on this city because of it? Yet you're bringing even more anger on Israel by violating the Sabbath."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, that when the gates of Jerusalem began to be dark before the sabbath, I commanded that the gates should be shut, and charged that they should not be opened till after the sabbath: and some of my servants set I at the gates, that there should no burden be brought in on the sabbath day.
verses.ct: So as the shadows began to fall on the gates of Jerusalem before the Sabbath started, I ordered the gates shut and insisted they stay closed until the Sabbath was over. I stationed some of my own servants at the gates so that no goods could be brought in on the Sabbath.

verses.kjv: So the merchants and sellers of all kind of ware lodged without Jerusalem once or twice.
verses.ct: Once or twice, the merchants and traders camped outside the walls of Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: Then I testified against them, and said unto them, Why lodge ye about the wall? if ye do so again, I will lay hands on you. From that time forth came they no more on the sabbath.
verses.ct: I warned them, "Why are you camping near the wall? If you do this again, I will have you arrested." From then on, they stopped coming on the Sabbath.

verses.kjv: And I commanded the Levites that they should cleanse themselves, and that they should come and keep the gates, to sanctify the sabbath day. Remember me, O my God, concerning this also, and spare me according to the greatness of thy mercy.
verses.ct: I also instructed the Levites to purify themselves and come guard the gates to keep the Sabbath holy. Remember me for this too, my God, and show me compassion because of your great mercy.

verses.kjv: In those days also saw I Jews that had married wives of Ashdod, of Ammon, and of Moab:
verses.ct: During those days, I also saw Jewish men who had married women from Ashdod, Ammon, and Moab.

verses.kjv: And their children spake half in the speech of Ashdod, and could not speak in the Jews’ language, but according to the language of each people.
verses.ct: Half their children spoke the language of Ashdod or the language of one of the other peoples, and none of them could speak the Jewish language.

verses.kjv: And I contended with them, and cursed them, and smote certain of them, and plucked off their hair, and made them swear by God, saying, Ye shall not give your daughters unto their sons, nor take their daughters unto your sons, or for yourselves.
verses.ct: I confronted them and called down curses on them. I struck some of them and pulled out their hair. Then I made them take an oath before God, saying, "You must not give your daughters in marriage to their sons, and you must not take their daughters as wives for your sons or for yourselves."

verses.kjv: Did not Solomon king of Israel sin by these things? yet among many nations was there no king like him, who was beloved of his God, and God made him king over all Israel: nevertheless even him did outlandish women cause to sin.
verses.ct: "Didn't King Solomon of Israel sin because of exactly this? Among all the nations, there was no king like him. He was loved by his God, and God made him king over all Israel — yet even he was led into sin by foreign women."

verses.kjv: Shall we then hearken unto you to do all this great evil, to transgress against our God in marrying strange wives?
verses.ct: "Should we then listen to you and commit this same terrible evil, betraying our God by marrying foreign women?"

verses.kjv: And one of the sons of Joiada, the son of Eliashib the high priest, was son in law to Sanballat the Horonite: therefore I chased him from me.
verses.ct: One of the sons of Joiada, son of Eliashib the high priest, had become the son-in-law of Sanballat the Horonite. So I drove him away from my presence.

verses.kjv: Remember them, O my God, because they have defiled the priesthood, and the covenant of the priesthood, and of the Levites.
verses.ct: Remember them, my God, because they have contaminated the priesthood and the covenant of the priests and the Levites.

verses.kjv: Thus cleansed I them from all strangers, and appointed the wards of the priests and the Levites, every one in his business;
verses.ct: So I purified them from everything foreign and assigned specific duties to the priests and Levites, each one to his own area of responsibility.

verses.kjv: And for the wood offering, at times appointed, and for the firstfruits. Remember me, O my God, for good.
verses.ct: I also arranged for the wood offerings at the designated times, and for the firstfruits. Remember me, my God, and treat me with kindness.
